nodes.name: Definition of addGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (addGoal a g) (exists (p e) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn' e g p)(changeTo e)))))
nodes.english: Agent a adds goal g if and only if there is a change to g being a subgoal in a's plan.

nodes.name: Definition of removeAchievedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (removeAchievedGoal a g) (exists (p e e1 e2) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn' e g p)(changeFrom' e1 e) (changeTo' e2 g)(cause e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: There is a change from g being a goal in agent a's Plan and this was caused by g becoming true in the real world.

nodes.name: Definition of abandonGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (abandonGoal a g) (exists (p e) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn' e g p)(changeFrom e) (not g)))))
nodes.english: There is a change from g being a subgoal in agent a's Plan even though g is not true, or does not hold.

nodes.name: Definition of removeViolatedGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g c) (iff (removeViolatedGoal a g c) (exists (p e e1 e2) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn' e g p)(changeFrom' e1 e) (impossible' e2 g c)(cause e2 e1)))))
nodes.english: This is one kind of goal abandonment, where the goal's impossibility (with respect to constraints c) is what causes the goal to be abandoned. Resignation is ceasing to have a goal because of a realization or belief that it is impossible to achieve.

nodes.name: Definition of suspendGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (suspendGoal a g) (exists (p e1 e2 e3 e4 t1 t2) (and (thePlan p a)(change e1 e2) (subgoalIn' e1 e3 p)(subgoalIn' e2 e4 p) (atTime' e3 g t1)(atTime' e4 g t2) (before t1 t2)))))
nodes.english: There is a change from a's wanting to do g at time t1 to a's wanting to do g at some later time t2.

nodes.name: Definition of modifyGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g1 g2) (iff (modifyGoal a g1 g2) (exists (p e1 e2) (and (change e1 e2)(thePlan p a) (subgoalIn' e1 g1 p)(subgoalIn' e2 g2 p) (similar g1 g2)))))
nodes.english: Agent a modifies goal g1 into goal g2, where g1 and g2 are similar in that they share properties.

nodes.name: Definition of specifyGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g1 g2) (iff (specifyGoal a g1 g2) (and (modifyGoal a g1 g2)(imply g2 g1))))
nodes.english: Agents can modify a goal to a more specific goal. The relation between the old and new goals is implication.

nodes.name: Definition of generalizeGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g1 g2) (iff (generalizeGoal a g1 g2) (and (modifyGoal a g1 g2)(imply g1 g2))))
nodes.english: Agents can modify a goal to a more general goal.

nodes.name: Definition of pursueGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (pursueGoal a g) (exists (p) (or (and (plan p a g)(ecs p a)) (planTo a g p) (try a g)))))
nodes.english: To be pursuing a goal is to be developing or executing a plan for achieving it. In line 4 the agent is just envisioning a plan, that is, planning. In line 5 the agent has decided on a plan to execute. In line 6 the agent is actually trying to achieve the goal.

nodes.name: Definition of priorityScale
nodes.fol: (forall (s a) (if (priorityScale s a) (and (agent a)(scale s))))
nodes.english: First, we introduce a priority scale for an agent.

nodes.name: Priority ordering based on importance
nodes.fol: (forall (p a g1 g2 g s1 s2 s3 s x11 x12 x2 x3 y1 y2) (if (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn g1 p)(subgoalIn g2 p) (importanceScale s1 a)(difficultyScale s2 g) (likelihoodScale s3) (instance g1 g)(instance g2 g) (priorityScale s a) (at g1 x11 s1)(at g2 x12 s1) (at g1 x2 s2)(at g2 x2 s2)(at g1 x3 s3)(at g2 x3 s3) (at g1 y1 s)(at g2 y2 s) (lts x11 x12 s1)(etc)) (lts y1 y2 s)))
nodes.english: If g1 and g2 are subgoals in agent a's Plan with same difficulty and likelihood but g1's importance is less than g2's, then g1's priority is less than g2's priority.

nodes.name: Definition of priority
nodes.fol: (forall (p g a) (iff (priority p g a) (exists (s) (and (priorityScale s a)(at g p s)))))
nodes.english: The priority of a goal is its location on the priority scale.

nodes.name: Definition of goalJustification
nodes.fol: (forall (e g a) (iff (goalJustification e g a) (exists (p g1) (and (thePlan p a)(subgoalIn g1 p) (plan e a g1)(subgoalIn g e)))))
nodes.english: A justification e for a goal g is a plan of which g is a part that links g with some goal g1 in the agent's Plan.

nodes.name: Definition of assessGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g e p) (if (priority' e p g a) (iff (assessGoal a g) (or (envisionFrom a g)(envisionFrom a e) (envisionTo a g)(envisionTo a e)))))
nodes.english: Where e is the property of p being the priority of goal g, then to assess g is to envision causal chains from or to g or e, thus exploring the causes or consequences of the goal or its priority.

nodes.name: Definition of conflict
nodes.fol: (forall (g1 g2) (iff (conflict g1 g2) (forall (t) (and (if (atTime g1 t)(not (atTime g2 t))) (if (atTime g2 t)(not (atTime g1 t)))))))
nodes.english: Two goals are in conflict if they cannot both obtain at the same time.

nodes.name: Definition of resolveConflictingGoals
nodes.fol: (forall (a g1 g2 g3 g4) (iff (resolveConflictingGoals a g1 g2 g3 g4) (and (modifyGoal a g1 g3)(modifyGoal a g2 g4) (conflict g1 g2)(not (conflict g3 g4)))))
nodes.english: Here goals g1 and g2 conflict with each other. Agent a modifies goal g1 to goal g3 and modifies goal g2 to g4, where g3 and g4 do not conflict.

nodes.name: Definition of preferGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g1 g2) (iff (preferGoal a g1 g2) (exists (e0 e1 e2 e3 e4 e) (and (and' e0 e1 e2)(arg* g1 e1)(arg* g2 e2) (pursueGoal' e3 a g1)(pursueGoal' e4 a g2) (cause e0 e)(prefer' e a e3 e4)))))
nodes.english: Here e3 is agent a's pursuit of goal g1, e4 is a's pursuit of g2, and a prefers the former to the latter, because of properties e1 of g1 and e2 of g2.

nodes.name: Definition of prioritizeGoal
nodes.fol: (forall (a g) (iff (prioritizeGoal a g) (exists (e1 e2 p1 p2) (and (goal g a)(change e1 e2) (priority' e1 p1 g a)(priority' e2 p2 g a)))))
nodes.english: Here p1 is the original priority of agent a's goal g, and p2 is the new priority.

nodes.name: High priority causes goal pursuit
nodes.fol: (forall (g a p e1 s1 s) (if (and (goal g a)(priority p g a)(inScale' e1 p s1) (Hi s1 s)(priorityScale s a)(etc)) (exists (e2) (and (pursueGoal' e2 a g)(cause e1 e2)))))
nodes.english: If agent a has goal g with priority p, then that priority's being high will defeasibly cause the goal to be pursued. This is the chief effect of priorities.

nodes.name: Low priority inhibits goal pursuit
nodes.fol: (forall (g a p e1 e2 s1 s) (if (and (goal g a)(priority p g a)(inScale' e1 p s1)(Lo s1 s) (priorityScale s a)(pursueGoal' e2 a g)(etc)) (exists (e3) (and (not' e3 e2)(cause e1 e3)))))
nodes.english: A goal with a low priority will defeasibly not be pursued. A low enough priority can lead to the goal's being abandoned.

node_types.variable: Frequently used variables (2+ axioms in chapter)
